org.java_bandwidthlimiter

Class StreamManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_bandwidthlimiter.StreamManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BandwidthLimiter

    public class StreamManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements BandwidthLimiter
    A class that manages the bandwidth of all the registered streams (both input and output streams). Note: when you see B, it stands for byte The maximum Downstream kilobits per sec speed can be set via setDownstreamKbps(long). The maximum Upstream kilobits per sec speed can be set via setUpstreamKbps(long). Additional latency can be added via setLatency(long). It is possible to fine tune the amount of payload that gets actually sent to the pipe via setPayloadPercentage(double). Note: there is no fairness in how the bandwidth is currently assigned to the registered streams. If this causes problems for your purposes you have to override/change registerStream(InputStream) registerStream(OutputStream) getAllowedBytesRead(org.java_bandwidthlimiter.StreamManager.ManagedInputStream, int) getAllowedBytesWrite(org.java_bandwidthlimiter.StreamManager.ManagedOutputStream, int) and implement fairness there.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamManager

        public StreamManager(long maxBitsPerSecond)
        Create an instance of StreamManager. This stream manager will throttle avery input/output stream is registered to it via registerStream(java.io.InputStream) and/or registerStream(java.io.OutputStream). It is disabled by default, hence to begin throttling enable() has to be called first.
        Parameters:
        maxBitsPerSecond - the default and max speed this instance of StreamManager will throttle to. It is an upper bound to what setDownstreamKbps(long) and setUpstreamKbps(long) can request. This upper bound can _only_ be changed via setMaxBitsPerSecondThreshold(long)

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Calling this method to start throttling all registered streams. By default the StreamManager is disabled

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Calling this method to stop throttling all registered streams. By default the StreamManager is disabled

      • setDownstreamKbps

        public void setDownstreamKbps(long downstreamKbps)
        setting the max kilobits per seconds this StreamManager should apply in downstream, as aggregate bandwidth of all the InputStream registered.
        Specified by:
        setDownstreamKbps in interface BandwidthLimiter
        Parameters:
        downstreamKbps - the desired max kilobits per second downstream rate.

      • setUpstreamKbps

        public void setUpstreamKbps(long upstreamKbps)
        setting the max kilobits per seconds this StreamManager should apply in upstream, as aggregate bandwidth of all the OutputStream registered.
        Specified by:
        setUpstreamKbps in interface BandwidthLimiter
        Parameters:
        upstreamKbps - the desired max kilobits per second upstream rate.

      • setLatency

        public void setLatency(long latency)
        setting the additional (simulated) latency that the streams will suffer. By default the latency applied is equal to zero.
        Specified by:
        setLatency in interface BandwidthLimiter
        Parameters:
        latency - the desired additional latency in milliseconds

      • setPayloadPercentage

        public void setPayloadPercentage(double payloadPercentage)
        To take into account overhead due to underlying protocols (e.g. TCP/IP)
        Parameters:
        payloadPercentage - a ] 0 , 100] value. where 1 means that the required downstream/upstream bandwidth will be full used for sending payload. Default value is 95%. This value is applied also if an out of boundaries value is passed in.

      • registerStream

        public java.io.InputStream registerStream(java.io.InputStream in)
        Register an input stream. A client would then use the returned InputStream, which will throttle the one passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream that will throttled
        Returns:
        a new throttled InputStream (wrapping the one given as parameter)

      • registerStream

        public java.io.OutputStream registerStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Register an output stream. A client would then use the returned OutputStream, which will throttle the one passed as parameter. * @param in The OutputStream that will be throttled
        Returns:
        a new throttled OutputStream (wrapping the one given as parameter)

      • setMaxBitsPerSecondThreshold

        public void setMaxBitsPerSecondThreshold(long maxBitsPerSecond)
        This function sets the max bits per second threshold setDownstreamKbps(long) and setDownstreamKbps(long) won't be allowed to set a bandwidth higher than what specified here.
        Parameters:
        maxBitsPerSecond - The max bits per seconds you want this instance of StreamManager to respect.
